column2: RHODE ISLAND PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Rhode Island
column6: RI

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 2. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column6: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column8: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column10: only if you have an emergency.

column2: 3. You should always travel:
column4: according to weather and road conditions.
column6: at the speed limit.
column8: at the speed of the vehicle behind.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Merging traffic from the right
column6: One-way traffic
column8: Intersection ahead

column2: 5. When merging onto an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: turn on their emergency flashers right before merging.
column6: always stop before entering the highway.
column8: select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.

column2: 6. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column6: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column10: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.

column2: 7. Before you change lanes, you should:
column4: keep other vehicles out of your blind spots.
column6: check your left mirror.
column8: look for other traffic by turning your head and looking behind you for oncoming traffic.

column2: 8. When passing another vehicle:
column4: honk your horn repeatedly to warn the other driver.
column6: there is no need to signal.
column8: you can exceed the posted speed limit.
column10: pass the vehicle as safely and as quickly as possible.

column2: 9. Passing is prohibited:
column4: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column8: at intersections.

column2: 10. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column4: finish crossing the street.
column6: go back and wait the “WALK” light
column8: yield to other pedestrians.

column2: 11. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: Can help improve vehicle stability.
column6: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
column8: It prevents skidding.

column2: 12. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may not turn right
column6: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
column8: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 13. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column6: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column8: get off the highway as quickly as possible.
column10: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.

column2: 14. When you see this sign you should:
column4: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column6: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column8: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column10: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Keep left
column6: Warning, slippery when wet
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 16. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column6: You must pass the school bus.
column8: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column10: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: School zone ahead
column6: Pedestrians must not cross here
column8: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead

column2: 18. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column4: expect the unexpected.
column6: slightly increase your speed.
column8: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.

column2: 19. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: can handle
column6: must not yield to
column8: must interrupt

column2: 20. To avoid hydroplaning you should:
column4: keep your tires properly inflated.
column6: slow down when roads are wet.
column8: stay away from puddles and standing water.

column2: 21. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.
column6: has no effect, they are different substances.
column8: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column10: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.

column2: 22. At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow:
column4: after making a complete stop first.
column6: if you are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.
column8: if you wait until the light changes.

column2: 23. You may not park:
column4: on a hill.
column6: in a parking lot.
column8: on a crosswalk or marked bicycle lane.
column10: within 200 feet of an elementary school.

column2: 24. Distractions that take your attention away from driving can be caused by ______ while driving.
column4: changing the radio
column6: using your cell phone
column8: eating or drinking

column2: 25. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: maintain their speed through the work zone.
column6: reduce their speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: closely follow the driver in front of them.
